name: buzzer.playSong
content:
Plays an array of notes one after the other at specified durations for each one.

[`buzzer.playSong()`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.playSong/) works just like [`buzzer.playNotes`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.playNotes/), except now you can determine the duration for each note, which allows you to create music like what you would normally hear.

palette_params.name: notes
palette_params.description: This is a two dimensional array of notes and duration (eg `[['C4'], 1], [['D4'], 1/2], [['E4'], 1/4]`). Each note will be played in sequence from first to last at the appropriate note length.

palette_params.name: tempo
palette_params.description: The tempo determines the speed at which the list of notes will be played, in beats per minute (or bpm). If a tempo is not included, notes will play at a default tempo of 120 bpm

short_description: Plays an array of notes one after the other at specified durations for each one.
